panel.title: Google Alerts
panel.html: "Google Alerts is a content change detection and notification service, offered by the search engine company Google. The service sends emails to the user when it finds new results—such as web pages, newspaper articles, blogs, or scientific research—that match the user's search term(s)" - the internetz Google alerts can be a great method to keep up-to-date on exploits or compromises that may affect your orginization. For example if you use the common content management system (CMS) Joomla! to host your external website, you may wish to set up a google alert for "Joomla + exploit". Install DNS twist using the instructions from dnstwist's github page. Once installed make sure you record the path to the dictionaries or execution path. In this example we have used all of the dnstwist options for data gathering and outpdnstwist trump.com -w -g -b -s -m -c -t 100 -d english.dict

panel.title: Google Alerts RSS and Splunk!
panel.html:
Once you are familar with using dnstwist and its output look at ingesting that data into Splunk
Using the domain you are attempting to emulate, create a cronjob that outputs the results of dnstwist into a CSV on a daily or weekly schedule
Configure Splunk to ingest the output of dnstwist csv as a lookup table
Use this lookup table with saved searches to find malicious domains in your network

search.query: |inputlookup google.csv | table published title summary url
